alert.note: Alert for Tippecanoe (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 15 at 10:15PM EST until February 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wildcat Creek near Lafayette affecting Tippecanoe County. Wabash River at Lafayette affecting Parke, Warren, Fountain, Tippecanoe and Vermillion Counties. .Rain, heavy at times, is expected to move into the region Wednesday evening, continuing through Thursday. Total rainfall accumulation of 2 to 3 inches is expected, leading to moderate flooding along points of the Upper Wabash River. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wildcat Creek near Lafayette. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night to Sunday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 19.0 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Wednesday morning by around 1100 AM EST.
